Mariane Cristina Donato Simões

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1676357085599498
  • Última atualização do currículo em 14/02/2019

Mestre em Anatomia pela Universidade de São Paulo (USP - 2018). Especialista em Reabilitação Esportiva pelo Instituto Vita (2011). Realizou Pós- Graduação de Dermato-funcional pela Universidade Metodista de Piracicaba (UNIMEP - 2008). Possui graduação em Fisioterapia pela Universidade Cidade de São Paulo (2005). Especialista em Disfunção temporomandibular (DTM) em 2016. Atualmente é fisioterapeuta do INSTITUTO VITA. Já trabalhou no Instituto Joaquim Grava, na clínica Fisiort e realizou atendimentos particulares (home care). Tem experiência na área de Fisioterapia, com ênfase em Reabilitação Ortopédica, atuando principalmente nos seguimentos: reabilitação de ortopedia e ortopedia esportiva, disfunção temporomandibular (DTM), Eletrólise Percutânea Intratisular (EPI) e Dermato-Funcional. Cursos: PIlates, EPI, Functional Paterns, Dry needling, DTM, RPG, Auriculoterapia, Watsu. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2016 - 2018
Avaliação morfofuncional e ultraestrutural do desenvolvimento do quadril em fetos humanos
Descrição: Morphofunctional and ultrastructural evaluation of the hip joint development in human fetuses Introduction: Studies on the normal sequential development of the hip joint (HJ) in human fetuses of different ages are scarce. The aim of this study is to evaluate the morphological and ultrastructural aspects of the joint cartilage of the proximal femoral head epiphysis in human fetuses between 16 to 31 weeks of intra uterine life (IUL). Materials and Methods: Twenty human fetuses were fixed in 10% formalin solution and preserved in glycerin. Fetuses were divided into 4 groups (n=5): Group 1 (G1): 16-19 weeks IUL; Group 2 (G2): 20-23 weeks IUL; Group 3 (G3): 24-27 weeks IUL and Group 4 (G4): 28-31 weeks IUL. The right moieties of the HJ were subjected to light microscopy to determine the chondrocyte area, volume, and density and the extracellular matrix (ECM) density. The collagen component in ECM was qualitatively evaluated using Safranin-O and picrosirius techniques under polarized light. The left portions were analyzed using scanning electron microscopy (SEM). Results: The advance of age revealed a gradual increase in the chondrocyte area and volume and in the ECM density, and decreased chondrocyte density. The apparent prevalence of type II collagen fibers in G1 and type III fibers in G4, as well as the balance between type I and III fibers in G2 and G3 suggest a process of cartilaginous evolution and repair. Conclusion: The pantographic organization of the collagen fiber meshes from the depth to the cartilage surface of the femoral head suggests that arcade collagen network architecture starts at the fetal stage. The morphological data may contribute not only to a better understanding of the maturation and cartilage organization in this area but also to serve as basis for aspects related to diseases and joint malformations. Keywords: human fetus, hip joint, cartilage, collagen fibers, chondrocytes, anatomy.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Mariane Cristina Donato Simões - Integrante / Edson Aparecido Liberti - Coordenador.
